text: [Music] [Music] so guys I'm here today with John Tracy who has been a part of D for many years over 20 in fact he was one of our boiler maker welders so we're going to have a little chat to him today about his experience with delate over the years thank you for joining me joh you're welcome um first of all I guess do you want to tell us a little bit about yourself where you're originally from and a bit about your life story well I was originally a farmer at chudley and then we eventually sold that farm and I moved into delone in 1983 I think it was you I was probably there for 2 years and David Cunningham came to see me about the worlding were you qualified or ini qualified I used to do welding on the farm and yes I enjoyed it my ambition was my next world will be better than my last it's a good ambition to have yeah and over your span of sort of that 20 years did you see a lot of change within D Mage yes and the Machinery was getting bigger and better and was most of your sort of your building work was it building new Machinery most of the time or new Machinery yes I don't think I ever did a repair first big roller we built was that big and heavy that we had to put a the friction brake okay under the bra to stop it from pushing you down Hills which I think it weighed when it was filled with water it weighed about 9 tons and was there a particular piece of Machinery that you particularly like to work on something that you were extra proud of at all or I guess rollers if I made $200 off yeah 200 wow what is it do you think that sets them apart within the industry you know they've got a pretty good reputation is there something the quality of the Machinery yeah yes it have to be speaks for itself really doesn't it well it does yeah I think nearly every phone R T's got a roller and as far as um you know working as a bower maker welder do you have any advice for anybody that is considering it as a career choice or that's a very good career choice and uh make sure when they're doing all these things that they have the the proper safety gear and breathing apparatus and all that sort of thing yeah yeah that's right definitely rewarding when you can see implements like this you know out in the padic many many years after you've built them isn't it and when you drive around the state you see blue and yellow and when you think about the fact that it's 50 years this year for dmate it is yep how does it sort of make you feel like is it do you feel a sense of pride of being a part of that or oh yes well definitely [Music] [Music]
